sources.data_found: Drexel College of Computing & Informatics (CCI) About page: 'A vibrant community of more than 2,500 undergraduate and 1,300 graduate students.'

student_data.notes: Exact CS department-level enrollment is not broken out on the public site, only College of Computing & Informatics (CCI) totals (2,500+ undergrad, 1,300+ grad). CS is the largest major within CCI. Counts are estimated as ~60% of the CCI total based on typical CS/Information Systems ratios and degree conferral data from DataUSA (showing CS as the dominant degree).

gpu_resources.notes: Primary resource is the 'Picotte' cluster. Specification: 12 GPU nodes × 4 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs = 48 A100 80GB total. Older clusters (Proteus) are considered legacy/retired and not listed in active high-performance inventory. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Drexel centralizes high-end GPU resources in the URCF 'Picotte' cluster. Student counts are derived from College of Computing & Informatics totals, as specific CS department rosters are not public.
